channel.title: Components on Cloud Native Buildpacks
channel.description: Recent content in Components on Cloud Native Buildpacks

item.title: Builder
item.description: A builder is an image that bundles all the bits and information on how to build your apps, such as buildpacks, an implementation of the lifecycle, and a build-time environment that platforms may use when executing the lifecycle.

item.title: Buildpack
item.description:
What is a buildpack?

A buildpack is a unit of work that inspects your app source code and formulates a plan to build and run your application.

item.title: Lifecycle
item.description:
What is the lifecycle?

The lifecycle orchestrates buildpack execution, then assembles the resulting artifacts into a final app image.

item.title: Platform
item.description:
What is a Platform?

A platform uses a lifecycle, buildpacks (packaged in a builder), and application source code to produce an OCI image.

item.title: Stack
item.description:
What is a stack?

A stack provides the buildpack lifecycle with build-time and run-time environments in the form of images.
